reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Provision of multi-sectorial response to COVID19 at Aleppo and Idleb areas

description.narrative:
AHF has 2 running CCTCs (Harim amp Maar Tmasrin by SCHF) amp Alsham isolation hospital (Dana by WHO) in response to COVID19 at NW Syria. In all the 3 facilities, there are identified gaps in FSL, health and protection services and this project aims to fill these gaps by providing integrated services in the respective sectors. For FSL and protection, the same beneficiaries will be targeted, for health, the interventions will complement the pre-established CCTCs with ambulance referral network.
FSL Even health staff and in-quarantine are provided with cooked meals, there is a gap in responding to family’s members who are affected. FSLs interventions will include: 1-Providing life-saving food assistance with one-time RTEs to 1500 HHs (7550 families members of infected individuals) for 4 months. 2-Providing life-saving food assistance with monthly restricted (50$) cash E-voucher to (600 chronic disease patients with their families members) for 8 months. The 600 HHs were selected according to specific criteria from the long list of chronic disease patients received from Idlib HD and validated by AHF team. Those 600 HHs are the most vulnerable to being affected by COVID19. The beneficiaries (Chronic diseases/annex01) will be provided with cash E-voucher to buy fresh food from the markets (where accessible) to prevent/reduce the risk of COVID19 infection. They will have freedom to choose from a variety of healthy food items including meat, chicken, vegetables etc.. (recommended food/annex 002). Extra amount will be added to monthly BL to cover soap cost (1$ for families of 5 members, 2$ for families of more than 5 members). the beneficiaries will receive cards and training to be able to buy their needs of specified food items (annex 03) Protection Proposed activities will be implemented on 2 levels and will be integrated with health and FSL, for 8 months: 1- CCTCs-lvl, isolated individuals will be provided with direct protection amp MHPSS assistance including: PFA, CP CM, MHPSS counselling ampCM, identification to safe referrals of at risk cases (CP,GBV and mental health), facilitating communication between isolated individuals and their relatives, and awareness session. 2- HH/community lvl, outreach teams will be mobilized to provide direct outreach assistance to families members of isolated individuals including: weekly HH visits to assess protection risks/basic needs, provide focused group PSS, identification to safe referrals of at risk cases, esp. GBV and mental health, distribution of DKs, PSS kits, awareness raising sessions on COVID19 topics. The protection teams will be teaming up and working very closely with health and FSL to ensure the effective integration and protection mainstreaming.
Health The COVID19 referral system is a part of COVID19 preparedness and response plan for NW Syria and it was established to facilitate patient transportation for emergency and not urgent medical suspected, probable and confirmed cases through ambulances and non-emergency patient transportation vehicles respectively and it is coordinated by a referral desk and supported through a referral capacity building. 25 locations of Initial referral stations were identified, in each location 2 vehicles will be existing only for COVID19 response, each staffed with 2-3 paramedics and 1-2 drivers. In each location a caravan will be attached for decontamination of the vehicles, staffed with 3 cleaners. The referral system links all initial stations, PoEs, referral Hospitals, CCTCs and other HFs, it links between 9 PoE, 28 CCTCs and 5 Isolation hospitals. Health activiteies are for 6 months and will contribute to strengthen COVID19 referral system by operating 10 ambulances, 5 existing ambulances in Dana2, Afrin2 and Harim1amp 5 new ambulances in Bennsh2, Darkosh1, Abin Samaan1 and Afrin1 will join COVID19 referral system to fill the gaps and cover 4 new locations of Initial referral stations, in each ambulance we'll have 2 paramedics and
